ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Lev 51 Selos got me killed!
ygData.msgSnippet: Same thing happens with the new scale of the wolf series for Shaman, it s a Very Bad Thing.  I think its cool that they gave travel only songs but they re
ygData.messageBody:
Same thing happens with the new scale of the wolf series for Shaman, it's a
Very Bad Thing. I think its cool that they gave travel only songs but
they're really not very practical. At least with Selo's you can keep trying
over and over.

Have to say though, Kunark is a blast :-)

Tani, 23rd Bard
Halana, 51st Shaman

I need more time to play :-(



-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:garramone@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 11, 2000 8:16 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Lev 51 Selos got me killed!

it almost got me killed for the same reasons in Burning
Woods. this song is
not for fighting and definitely NOT for escape, especially
against casters.
every time i would finally get it to pulse, blam i get hit
by a spell and it
falls, because of the invisibility effect. for this same
reason, niv's
melody and nillipus' march drop because they have a rune
effect. as soon as
it's exceeded (which is one hit from these mobs) the whole
effect drops.

Shada Powa, L53 Wood Elf Minstrel
Tyria Sarkin, L50 High Elf Wizard
<Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server


> Last night, I was tracking and pulling in Trakanons. At
first
> was using my Selos drum and out running the mobs thus
losing
> them. So I switched to weps and was slow enough but
noticed something.
>
> When you get attacked or attack something, while playing
SSoT
> (song of travel), the effect drops immediately. And you
have
> to re-key it to get going again. It looks like it will be
> un-workable for fighting mobs if it drops as soon as you
key
> anything else.
